answers.answer: Don't EVER drain anything on a child who is on steroids.  They are horribly susceptible to infection due to the suppression of their immune systems.  Take him to the doctor to address your concerns.
Thank-you.  I am taking him to outpatient.
Hi another question.  I took him to outpatient and tyhey found nothing wrong but am having me come back in a week as their was some blood in his urine...did the stick test.  What is that a sign of?

question: My 11 year old son is on steroids for asthma.  The Dr. has ordered a CBC for him but not until September as she is concerned about diabetes. He is overweight and last week he was at my Mom's and she said he drank a lot.   Last night he woke with a temperature of 101.5 and is complaining that the top of his right arm hurts but I cannot see anything wrong with it and his temp is back down to normal.He had a sore very small on his leg near his knee that was filled with puss and I drained it last night.  Any ideas?  Should I take him in for a blood sugar test?
title: Diabetes and fever?
